title: How can I use my phone handsfree while driving when voice unlock has been restricted?
content:
Google has restricted voice unlock (via Smart Lock) to selected tasks. Opening apps and making calls is no longer possible hands-free (although dictating SMS is still available).

I understand why Google has done this — for security.

But…

This is a problem when driving, because here in the UK, we are not permitted to touch our phone at all while at the wheel. So, for example, when stuck in a major traffic jam, I can't telephone my destination to let them know that I'll be late.

So…

How can I make calls and open apps (such as Waze) hands-free while driving?

Thanks
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 2
